org.jvoicexml.interpreter.formitem
Class InputItem

java.lang.Object
  org.jvoicexml.interpreter.formitem.AbstractFormItem
      org.jvoicexml.interpreter.formitem.InputItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
DialogConstruct, FormItem, PromptCountable, FormItemVisitable
Direct Known Subclasses:
FieldFormItem, ObjectFormItem, RecordFormItem, SubdialogFormItem, TransferFormItem
public abstract class InputItem
extends AbstractFormItem
implements PromptCountable

Implementation of a input item. Main purpose of this class is to allow a distinction between input items and control items.

An input item specifies an input item variable to gather input from the user. Input items have prompts to tell the user what to say or key in, grammars that define the allowed inputs, and event handlers that process any resulting events. An input item may also have a <filled> element that defines an action to take just after the input item variable is filled.

Version:
$Revision: 214 $

Copyright © 2005-2006 JVoiceXML group - http://jvoicexml.sourceforge.net/

See Also:
